column4: I don't have the volume control in the top right corner of my screen. I need to see which applet that is
think indicator
The Indicator applet version 0.3.6 doesn't appear to be configurable in letting me say (or see) what it should indicate.
oh
I just check Synaptic and discovered there is an indicator-sound package.
i think its installed by default
It might be on a fresh install but it wasn't installed on my machine. I have installed it now.
custom install?
Not exactly. Upgrade from 9.10
I do get rid of some stuff I don't need (like Evolution)
that can cause issue sometime, but hey you can always try to reset panels
eek. Shouldn't have done the unset part. Now a lot of the icons I had added to the top panel are gone.
told you it would reset !
It certainly did. I thought you just meant reset as in stop and start up again. on, well. I'll just add the icons to the top bar again
great
Added volume control indicator package and removed the ones for me and messages.
I logged out and in again. All my top panel icons are back. :-)
default ones or the one you customized?
My customized ones.
great then
I got the ~/.gconf* dirs off my system backup I made last night before I upgraded to 10.04
Using my backup saved me from putting back the 15 panel applets I have in the top panel. :-)
